metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23240 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - negligible
metadata.Description:
selinux_edit_copy_tfiles in sudoedit in Sudo before 1.9.5 allows a localunprivileged user to gain file ownership and escalate privileges byreplacing a temporary file with a symlink to an arbitrary file target. Thisaffects SELinux RBAC support in permissive mode. Machines without SELinuxare not vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sudo - 1.9.9-1ubuntu2
sudo-ldap - 1.9.9-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sudo package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.9-1ubuntu2').
